page.title: 12Radipole Lake,Weymouth.
page.content: { Radipole Lake}is an{RSPB controlled {nature reserve}that is situated very close to the{town centre}and so is an obvious{attraction to visitors}to the town.It is a{well planned reserve}with {numerous walks and 3 hides}that allow visitors to{observe}both{resident and {migrant birds.}Recently{tap rails}have been installed for the{blind}and{audio {posts}that{give information}on what can be seen in the vicinity.Apart from the wide variety of summer and winter visitors,Radipole Lake has an interesting variety of{resident {birds,}most notably the{Cettis {Warbler,}a{rare bird}that arrived in {1976.}The{first male}to arrive nicknamed{'Cecil'}is still there today.
